title: Steve Vai - Sex & Religion [FLAC]
description:
Review	by Stephen Thomas Erlewine

Steve Vai formed a new straight-ahead heavy metal combo for the follow-up to his instrumental masterpiece, Passion and Warfare. In this context, the imaginative guitarist is saddled down by a pedestrian band and an overwrought vocalist, which limits Vai's ability to stretch out. Consequently, the record is the most predictable and conventional -- not to mention boring -- of Vai's usually remarkable career. 

Rip has been made by Sound Juicer version 2.22.0.
Encoding has been executed by FLAC version 1.2.1.
